intro: Leucopogon moluccanus, commonly known as the Moluccan heath, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
